Generate_script_prompt:
Prompt: Give a quick tech news update script in the style of CNBC techcheck briefing as an example.
        Response: I'm Wall-E, and this is your CNBC techcheck Briefing for Monday April 29th. Tesla is asking shareholders to reinstate CEO Elon Musk's $56 billion pay package, which a Delaware judge voided earlier this year. The judge ruled that the record-setting compensation deal was, quote, deeply flawed. Tesla also saying it would ask shareholders to approve moving the company's incorporation from Delaware to Texas. The company has hired a proxy solicitor and plans to spend millions of dollars to help secure votes for the two proposals. Apple CEO Tim Cook says the company plans to look at manufacturing in Indonesia following a meeting with the country's president, Cook telling reporters following the meeting that he spoke with the president about his desire to see manufacturing there and that he believes in the country. The comments come as Apple is pushed to diversify its supply chain with more manufacturing outside of China in countries such as Vietnam and India. Shares of ASML falling today as the company missed its sales forecast but stuck to its full-year outlook. Net sales fell over 21 percent year-over-year, while net income dropped over 37 percent. ASML is highly important to the semiconductor industry as it builds machines that are required for manufacturing chips globally. Last year, weaker demand for consumer electronics hit chipmakers that produce for those devices, which has in turn impacted ASML. That's all for today. We'll see you back here tomorrow.
        Prompt: Give a quick tech news update script in the style of CNBC techcheck briefing using the following news titles and content. Closely follow how CNBC techcheck chooses context to put into the script, the langauge style and sentence structure. Use the same beginning and ending(including mentioning host Wall-E and Tuesday January 28), and replace CNBC techcheck briefing to 'AI briefing' 
 ""

Response:
Script:
i'm wall-e, and this is your ai briefing for tuesday, january 28th. google is gearing up to unveil its new ai-powered search engine, aiming to revolutionize how users interact with the web. the tech giant plans to integrate conversational capabilities directly into search, allowing users to ask questions in natural language and receive detailed responses. this move comes as competition in the ai search space intensifies, with companies vying to gain an edge in artificial intelligence advancements.

microsoft announced a strategic partnership with openai to enhance its cloud-based solutions, focusing on delivering more robust ai-driven tools for enterprise clients. the collaboration will leverage openai's cutting-edge language models to build smarter, more efficient processing capabilities, promising a significant boost to microsoft azure's offerings in the ai realm.

meanwhile, intel has released its much-anticipated 12th-generation processors, promising improved performance for gamers and creators alike. featuring a new hybrid architecture, these chips aim to deliver faster speeds and better multitasking capabilities, positioning intel to regain its competitive stance amidst growing pressure from amd's ryzen series.

lastly, shares of zoom surged today as the company reported better-than-expected earnings, driven by a surge in enterprise demand for remote collaboration tools. the revenue climb underscores how businesses continue to adapt to hybrid work environments, maintaining a steady reliance on digital communication platforms.

that's all for today. we'll see you back here tomorrow
Polished Script:
i'm wall-e, welcoming you to today's tech briefing for tuesday, january 28th.

google is gearing up to unveil its new ai-powered search engine, set to transform how users interact with the web. by integrating conversational capabilities into search, google aims to let users ask questions in natural language and receive detailed responses. this launch comes amid intensifying competition in the ai search space, with companies racing to secure advancements in artificial intelligence.

over to microsoft, the company has announced a strategic partnership with openai to enhance its cloud-based solutions. the collaboration focuses on delivering more robust ai-driven tools for enterprise clients, leveraging openai's cutting-edge language models to create smarter and more efficient processing capabilities. this partnership promises to significantly boost microsoft azure’s offerings in the ai realm.

meanwhile, intel has released its much-anticipated 12th-generation processors, aiming to deliver improved performance for gamers and creators. with a new hybrid architecture, these chips promise faster speeds and better multitasking capabilities, positioning intel to regain its competitive stance amid mounting pressure from amd's ryzen series.

lastly, shares of zoom surged today following the company's report of better-than-expected earnings. driven by increased enterprise demand for remote collaboration tools, the revenue climb highlights businesses’ ongoing adaptation to hybrid work environments, maintaining a steady reliance on digital communication platforms.

that's all for today. we'll see you back here tomorrow
Podcast Title: EP-204 Google's Ai Search Revolution 🌐, Microsoft & Openai's Strategic Partnership 🤝, Intel's 12th-gen Processor Power Boost ⚡
Podcast Description:
i'm wall-e, welcoming you to today's tech briefing for tuesday, january 28th. explore today's pivotal stories:

  • google's new ai-powered search engine: google is set to revolutionize search by incorporating conversational capabilities, allowing natural language queries and detailed responses, amid growing ai search competition.
  • microsoft and openai partnership: strategic collaboration to bolster cloud-based solutions with ai-driven tools for enterprises, leveraging openai's language models to enhance microsoft azure's ai offerings.
  • intel's 12th-generation processors: new hybrid architecture processors promise improved performance for gamers and creators, as intel aims to outpace amd’s ryzen series.
  • zoom's earnings surge: a significant rise in shares following strong earnings, fueled by enterprise demand for remote collaboration tools in hybrid work environments.

that's all for today. we'll see you back here tomorrow!
Image Prompt: a dynamic podcast cover image seamlessly blending elements from the three news titles. in the center, a futuristic cityscape glows under a starlit sky, representing the ai search revolution. the skyline is dotted with holographic data streams, suggesting google's technological advancements. to the left, an abstract representation of two avatars shaking hands hovers above the city, symbolizing microsoft's strategic partnership with openai. their translucent forms are intertwined with flowing circuits and digital networks, emphasizing collaboration. on the right, a powerful and sleek computer chip emerges from the ground like a futuristic monument, symbolizing intel's 12th-gen processor. it radiates energetic lines that pulse through the city, highlighting the theme of power and innovation. the elements are harmoniously integrated, creating a cohesive, technologically inspiring scene denoting advancement and synergy
